SwiftMessageFormat.name: MT565
SwiftMessageFormat.Description:
This message is sent by an account owner to an account servicer (account servicing institution). The account owner may be a global custodian which has an account with its local agent (sub custodian) or an investment management institution or a broker/dealer which has an account with their custodian.
This message is used to provide the custodian with instructions on how the account owner wishes to proceed with a corporate action event. Instructions include investment decisions regarding the exercise of rights issues, the election of stock or cash when the option is available, and decisions on the conversion or tendering of securities.
This message may also be used to:
a) request the cancellation of a previously sent corporate action instruction
b) re-send a corporate action instruction previously sent
c) provide a third party with a copy of the message.

Validation.Comment: Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).
Function must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T86):

Code.Name: CANC
Code.Description: Message requesting the cancellation of a previously sent message.

Code.Name: NEWM
Code.Description: New message.

Validation.Comment: Subfunction, when present, must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): T85):

Code.Name: CODU
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes and the message is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Code.Name: COPY
Code.Description: Message is a copy to a party other than the account owner/account servicer, for information purposes.

Code.Name: DUPL
Code.Description: Message is for information/confirmation purposes. It is a duplicate of a message previously sent.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is CAEV and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: ACTV
Code.Description: Trading in the security has commenced or security has been re-activated after a suspension in trading.

Code.Name: ATTI
Code.Description: Combination of different security types to create a unit. Units are usually comprised of warrants and bonds or warrants and equities. Securities may be combined at the request of the security holder or based on market convention

Code.Name: BIDS
Code.Description: Offer to existing holders by the issuing company to repurchase its own securities. The objective of the offer is to reduce the number of outstanding securities

Code.Name: BMET
Code.Description: Physical meeting of bond holders.

Code.Name: BONU
Code.Description: Bonus or capitalisation issue. Security holders receive additional assets free of payment from the issuer, in proportion to their holding

Code.Name: BPUT
Code.Description: Early redemption of a security at the election of the holder subject to the terms and condition of the issue with no reduction in nominal value .

Code.Name: BRUP
Code.Description: Legal status of a company unable to pay creditors. Bankruptcy is involuntary and usually involves a formal court ruling. The securities may become valueless

Code.Name: CAPD
Code.Description: The Corporate event pays shareholders an amount in cash issued from the Capital account. There is no reduction to the face value of a single share (or the share has no par value). The number of circulating shares remains unchanged.

Code.Name: CAPG
Code.Description: Distribution of profits resulting from the sale of company assets, eg, Shareholders of Mutual Funds , Unit Trusts , or Sicavs are recipients of capital gains distributions which are often reinvested in additional shares of the fund

Code.Name: CAPI
Code.Description: Increase of the current principal of a debt instrument without increasing the nominal value. It normally arises from the incorporation of due but unpaid interest into the principal. This is commonly done by increasing the pool factor value, eg, capitalisation, and negative amortization.

Code.Name: CERT
Code.Description: Non-US beneficial owner certification requirement for exchange of temporary to permanent notes

Code.Name: CHAN
Code.Description: Information regarding a change further described in the corporate action details.

Code.Name: CLSA
Code.Description: Situation where interested parties seek restitution for financial loss. The security holder may be offered the opportunity to join a class action proceeding and would need to respond with an instruction

Code.Name: CMET
Code.Description: Announcement of a meeting at a Court

Code.Name: CONS
Code.Description: Procedure that aims to obtain consent of holder to a proposal by the issuer or a third party without convening a meeting. For example, consent to change the terms of a bond.

Code.Name: CONV
Code.Description: Conversion of securities (generally convertible bonds or preferred shares), into another form of securities (usually common shares) at a pre-stated price/ratio

Code.Name: COOP
Code.Description: A Company Option may be granted by the company, allowing the holder to take up shares at some future date(s) at a pre arranged price in the company. A company may not grant options which enable the holder to take up unissued shares at a time which is five or more years from the date of the grant. Option holders are not members of a company. They are contingent creditors of a company and hence may, in some instances, be entitled to vote on and be bound by a scheme of arrangement between the creditors and the company. As many options have multiple exercise periods a company option will either lapse or carry on to the next expiry date

Code.Name: CREV
Code.Description: An occurrence of credit derivative for which the issuer of one or several underlying securities is unable to fulfill his financial obligations (as defined in terms and conditions).

Code.Name: DECR
Code.Description: Reduction of face value of a single share or the value of fund assets . The number of circulating shares/units remains unchanged. This event may include a cash payout to holders.

Code.Name: DETI
Code.Description: Separation of components that comprise a security, eg, usually units comprised of warrants and bond or warrants and equity . Units may be broken up at the request of the security holder or based on market convention

Code.Name: DFLT
Code.Description: Failure by the company to perform obligations defined as default events under the bond agreement and that have not been remedied

Code.Name: DLST
Code.Description: Security is no longer able to comply with the listing requirements of a stock exchange and is removed from official board quotation

Code.Name: DRAW
Code.Description: Redemption in part before the scheduled final maturity date of a security. Drawing is distinct from partial call since drawn bonds are chosen by lottery and with no reduction in nominal value

Code.Name: DRCA
Code.DetailedName: Cash Distribution From Non-Eligible Securities Sales
Code.Description: Distribution to shareholders of cash resulting from the selling of non-eligible securities, for example, in the frame of a depositary receipt program.

Code.Name: DRIP
Code.Description: Dividend payment where holders can keep cash or have the cash reinvested in the market by the issuer into additional shares in the issuing company. To be distinguished from DVOP as the company invests the dividend in the market rather than creating new share capital in exchange for the dividend

Code.Name: DSCL
Code.Description: Requirement for holders or beneficial owners to disclose their name, location and holdings of any issue to the issuer

Code.Name: DTCH
Code.Description: An action by a party wishing to acquire a security. Holders of the security are invited to make an offer to sell, within a specific price range. The acquiring party will buy from the holder with lowest offer

Code.Name: DVCA
Code.Description: Distribution of cash to shareholders, in proportion to their equity holding. Ordinary dividends are recurring and regular

Code.Name: DVOP
Code.Description: Distribution of a dividend to shareholders with a choice of benefit to receive. Shareholders may choose to receive shares or cash. To be distinguished from DRIP as the company creates new share capital in exchange for the dividend rather than investing the dividend in the market.

Code.Name: DVSC
Code.Description: Dividend or interest paid in the form of scrip

Code.Name: DVSE
Code.Description: Dividend paid to shareholders in the form of equities of the issuing corporation

Code.Name: EXOF
Code.Description: Exchange of holdings for other securities and/or cash. The exchange can be either mandatory or voluntary involving the exchange of outstanding securities for different securities and/or cash. For example "exchange offer" ,"capital reorganisation" or "funds separation" .

Code.Name: EXRI
Code.Description: Call or exercise on nil paid securities or intermediate securities resulting from an intermediate securities distribution (RHDI). This code is used for the second event, when an intermediate securities' issue (rights/coupon) is composed of two events, the first event being the distribution of intermediate securities.

Code.Name: EXTM
Code.Description: As stipulated in a bond's Terms and Conditions, the issuer or the bond-holder may prolong the maturity date of a bond. After extension, the security may differ from original issue (new rate or maturity date). May be subject to bondholder's approval

Code.Name: EXWA
Code.Description: Option offered to holders to buy (call warrant) or to sell (put warrant) a specific amount of stock, cash, or commodity, at a predetermined price, during a predetermined period of time (which usually corresponds to the life of the issue).

Code.Name: INCR
Code.Description: Increase in the face value of a single security. The number of circulating securities remains unchanged

Code.Name: INTR
Code.Description: Interest payment distributed to holders of an interest bearing asset

Code.Name: LIQU
Code.Description: A distribution of cash, assets or both. Debt may be paid in order of priority based on preferred claims to assets specified by the security

Code.Name: MCAL
Code.Description: The redemption of an entire issue outstanding of securities, eg, bonds, preferred equity, funds, by the issuer or its agent, eg, asset manager, before final maturity.

Code.Name: MEET
Code.Description: Annual general meeting

Code.Name: MRGR
Code.Description: Exchange of outstanding securities, initiated by the issuer which may include options, as the result of two or more companies combining assets, ie, an external, third party company . Cash payments may accompany share exchange

Code.Name: NOOF
Code.Description: Offers that are not supervised or regulated by an official entity and being offered by a party, for example a broker, usually at a discount price, for example broker offer, mini-tender, mini odd lot offer or third party offer.

Code.Name: ODLT
Code.Description: Sale or purchase of odd-lots to/from the issuing company, initiated either by the holder of the security or through an offer made by the issuer

Code.Name: OMET
Code.Description: Ordinary general meeting

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other event, use only when no other event type applies, eg, a new event type.

Code.Name: PARI
Code.Description: Occurs when securities with different characteristics, eg, shares with different entitlements to dividend or voting rights, become identical in all respects, eg , pari-passu or assimilation . May be scheduled in advance, eg, shares resulting from a bonus may become fungible after a pre-set period of time, or may result from outside events, eg, merger, reorganisation, issue of supplementary tranches, etc

Code.Name: PCAL
Code.DetailedName: Partial Redemption With Reduction of Nominal Value
Code.Description: Securities are redeemed in part before their scheduled final maturity date with reduction of the nominal value of the securities. The outstanding amount of securities will be reduced proportionally

Code.Name: PDEF
Code.Description: Issuer has money set aside to redeem a portion of an issue and the indenture states that the securities could be called earlier than the stated maturity

Code.Name: PINK
Code.Description: Interest payment, in any kind except cash, distributed to holders of an interest bearing asset.

Code.Name: PLAC
Code.Description: Changes in the state of incorporation for US companies and changes in the place of incorporation for foreign companies. Where shares need to be registered following the incorporation change, the holder(s) may have to elect the registrar

Code.Name: PPMT
Code.Description: An instalment towards the purchase of equity capital, subject to an agreement between an issuer and a purchaser

Code.Name: PRED
Code.DetailedName: Partial Redemption Without Reduction of Nominal Value
Code.Description: Securities are redeemed in part before their scheduled final maturity date without reduction of the nominal value of the securities. This is commonly done by pool factor reduction.

Code.Name: PRII
Code.Description: An event which consists of two components, the decrease of the amortized value of a pool factor security and an interest payment.

Code.Name: PRIO
Code.Description: Form of open or public offer where, due to a limited amount of securities available, priority is given to existing shareholders

Code.Name: REDM
Code.Description: The redemption of an entire issue outstanding of securities, eg, bonds, preferred equity, funds, by the issuer or its agent, eg, asset manager,at final maturity.

Code.Name: REDO
Code.Description: Event by which the unit (currency and/or nominal) of a security is restated, eg, nominal/par value of security in a national currency is restated in another currency.

Code.Name: REMK
Code.Description: Purchase and sale of remarketed preferred equities/bonds through the negotiation of interest rate between the issuers and the holders

Code.Name: RHDI
Code.Description: The distribution of intermediate securities that gives the holder the right to take part in a future event

Code.Name: RHTS
Code.Description: Offer to holders of a security to subscribe for additional securities via the distribution of an intermediate security. Both processes are included in the same event.

Code.Name: SHPR
Code.Description: This corporate event pays shareholders an amount in cash issued from the shares premium reserve. It is similar to a dividend but with different tax implications

Code.Name: SMAL
Code.Description: Modification of the smallest negotiable unit of shares in order to obtain a new negotiable unit

Code.Name: SOFF
Code.Description: A distribution of securities issued by another company. The distributed securities may either be of a newly created or of an existing company. For example, spin-off, demerger, unbundling, divestment.

Code.Name: SPLF
Code.Description: Increase in a corporation's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are reduced accordingly

Code.Name: SPLR
Code.DetailedName: Reverse Stock Split/Change in Nominal Value
Code.Description: Decrease in a company's number of outstanding equities without any change in the shareholder's equity or the aggregate market value at the time of the split. Equity price and nominal value are increased accordingly

Code.Name: SUSP
Code.Description: Trading in securities has been suspended

Code.Name: TEND
Code.Description: An offer made to holders by a third party, requesting them to sell (tender) or exchange their securities

Code.Name: TREC
Code.Description: Event related to tax reclaim activities

Code.Name: WRTH
Code.Description: Booking out of valueless securities.

Code.Name: WTRC
Code.Description: Certification process for withholding tax reduction or exemption based on the tax status of the holder

Code.Name: XMET
Code.Description: Extraordinary or special general meeting.

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50).
Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38).
If Qualifier is LINK and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: AFTE
Code.Description: Indicates that the message is to be processed after the linked message.

Code.Name: BEFO
Code.Description: Indicates that the message is to be processed before the linked message.

Code.Name: INFO
Code.Description: Indicates that the messages are linked for information purposes only.

Code.Name: WITH
Code.Description: Indicates that the message is to be processed with the linked message.

Validation.Comment: Number (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).
Reference must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).

Option.Name: B
Option.Specification: (Identification Of Security)(Description Of Security) |(Description Of Security)

Validation.Comment: Narrative must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).
In option B, if Data Source Scheme is not present, Place Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K94):

Code.Name: EXCH
Code.Description: Place of listing is a stock exchange.

Code.Name: OTCO
Code.Description: Place of listing is over the counter.

Code.Name: PRIM
Code.Description: Place of listing is the primary market.

Code.Name: SECM
Code.Description: Place of listing is the secondary market.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is MICO and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: A001
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February, and provided that the interest period started on a 30th or a 31st. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th if the period started on a 30th or a 31st and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for US straight and convertible bonds

Code.Name: A002
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and a 365-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th).

Code.Name: A003
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month in a way similar to the 30/360 (basic rule) and the assumed number of days in a year in a way similar to the Actual/Actual (ICMA). Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). The assumed number of days in a year is computed as the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year

Code.Name: A004
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 360-day year

Code.Name: A005
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: A006
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and the assumed number of days in a year, ie, the actual number of days in the coupon period multiplied by the number of interest payments in the year. If the coupon period is irregular (first or last coupon), it is extended or split into quasi interest periods that have the length of a regular coupon period and the computation is operated separately on each quasi interest period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A007
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. However, if the last day of the maturity coupon period is the last day of February, it will not be assumed to be a 30th. It is a variation of the 30/360 (ICMA) method commonly used for eurobonds. The usage of this variation is only relevant when the coupon periods are scheduled to end on the last day of the month.

Code.Name: A008
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days of the interest period that fall on a normal year divided by 365, added to the actual number of days of the interest period that fall on a leap year divided by 366.

Code.Name: A009
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 365-day year (if the coupon payment date is NOT in a leap year) or a 366-day year (if the coupon payment date is in a leap year).

Code.Name: A010
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days and a 366-day year (if 29 Feb falls in the coupon period) or a 365-day year (if 29 Feb does not fall in the coupon period). If a coupon period is longer than one year, it is split by repetitively separating full year sub-periods counting backwards from the end of the coupon period (a year backwards from a 28 Feb being 29 Feb, if it exists). The first of the sub-periods starts on the start date of the accrued interest period and thus is possibly shorter than a year. Then the interest computation is operated separately on each sub-period and the intermediate results are summed up.

Code.Name: A011
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for February. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be a 28th (or 29th). It is the most commonly used 30/360 method for non-US straight and convertible bonds issued before 01/01/1999.

Code.Name: A012
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month, except for the last day of February whose day of the month value shall be adapted to the value of the first day of the interest period if the latter is higher and if the period is one of a regular schedule. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28th Feb of a non-leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 29th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 29th, or to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. The 29th Feb of a leap year is assumed to be equivalent to a 30th Feb when the first day of the interest period is a 30th or a 31st. Similarly, if the coupon period starts on the last day of February, it is assumed to produce only one day of interest in February as if it was starting on a 30th Feb when the end of the period is a 30th or a 31st, or two days of interest in February when the end of the period is a 29th, or 3 days of interest in February when it is the 28th Feb of a non-leap year and the end of the period is before the 29th.

Code.Name: A013
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on a 30-day month and a 360-day year. Accrued interest to a value date on the last day of a month shall be the same as to the 30th calendar day of the same month. This means that a 31st is assumed to be a 30th and the 28 Feb (or 29 Feb for a leap year) is assumed to be equivalent to a 30 Feb. It is a variation of the 30E/360 (or Eurobond basis) method where the last day of February is always assumed to be a 30th, even if it is the last day of the maturity coupon period.

Code.Name: A014
Code.Description: Method whereby interest is calculated based on the actual number of accrued days in the interest period, excluding any leap day from the count, and a 365-day year.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Other method than A001-A014. See Narrative.

Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).

Validation.Qualifiers: CALD, CONV, COUP, DDTE, EXPI, FRNR, ISSU, MATU, PUTT
Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50).
When Sign is present, Rate must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).
Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36):

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares

Validation.Comment: Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)
Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'.(Error code(s): T26).
Narrative (Format Option B) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//' (Error code(s): T26).
Country must be a valid ISO country code (Error code(s): T73).
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)
In option B, when Data Source Scheme is not present, Place Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s):K94):

Code.Name: ALLP
Code.Description: Used when there is a need to indicate that the details apply to all places of safekeeping where the financial instrument is held.

Code.Name: SHHE
Code.Description: Used for certain financial instruments, eg, US mutual funds, where settlement is internal only, ie, there is no external movement of securities.

Validation.Comment: In option F, Place Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K94):

Code.Name: CUST
Code.Description: Financial instruments held at a local custodian.

Code.Name: ICSD
Code.Description: Financial instruments held at an International Central Securities Depository.

Code.Name: NCSD
Code.Description: Financial instruments held at a National Central Securities Depository.

Code.Name: SHHE
Code.Description: Used for certain financial instruments, eg, US mutual funds, where settlement is internal only, ie, there is no external movement of securities.

Qualifier.Name: ELIG
Qualifier.Description: Total Eligible for Corporate Action Balance

Validation.Qualifiers: BLOK, BORR, COLI, COLO, ELIG, LOAN, NOMI, PEND, PENR, REGO, SETT, SPOS, TRAD, TRAN
Validation.Comment: When Sign is present, Balance must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).

Validation.Qualifiers: BLOK, BORR, COLI, COLO, LOAN, NOMI, PEND, PENR, REGO, SETT, SPOS, TRAD, TRAN
Validation.Comment: Balance Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K93):

Code.Name: ELIG
Code.Description: Balance is eligible for this corporate action

Code.Name: NELG
Code.Description: Balance is not eligible for this corporate action

Validation.Qualifiers: BLOK, BORR, COLI, COLO, ELIG, LOAN, NOMI, PEND, PENR, REGO, SETT, SPOS, TRAD, TRAN
Validation.Comment: If Data Source Scheme is not present, Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K93):

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares.

Option.Name: S
Option.Specification: (Qualifier) (Data Source Scheme) (Type of ID) (Country Code) (Alternate ID)

Validation.Comment: Country Code must be a valid ISO country code (Error code(s): T73).
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26).

Name & Address (Format Option V) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26).

Alternate ID (Format Option S) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26).
When Data Source Scheme is not present, Type of ID must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K95):

Code.Name: ARNU
Code.Description: Number assigned by a government agency to identify foreign nationals.

Code.Name: CCPT
Code.Description: Number assigned by a passport authority.

Code.Name: CORP
Code.Description: Number assigned to a corporate entity.

Code.Name: DRLC
Code.Description: Number assigned to a driver's license.

Code.Name: FIIN
Code.Description: Number assigned to a foreign investor (other than the alien number).

Code.Name: TXID
Code.Description: Number assigned by a tax authority to an entity.

Validation.Comment: Country Code must be a valid ISO country code (Error code(s): T73).
Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36):

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, that is, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, for example, a number of shares.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is CETI and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: ACCI
Code.Description: The holder of the security irrevocably certifies that it is an Accredited Investor as defined in US Securities and Exchange Commission Regulation D.

Code.Name: NCOM
Code.Description: The holder of the security is certifying he is an Non-Company related person.

Code.Name: QIBB
Code.Description: The holder of the security irrevocably certifies that it is a Qualified Institutional Buyer as defined in US Securities and Exchange Commission Rule 144A.

Validation.Comment: n option F, if Qualifier is DISF and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: BUYU
Code.Description: Buy securities up to next whole number

Code.Name: CINL
Code.Description: Receive cash in lieu of fractions

Code.Name: DIST
Code.Description: Take distribution of fractions in the form of securities

Code.Name: EXPI
Code.Description: Let fractions expire worthless

Validation.Comment: In option F, if Qualifier is CAOP and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: ABST
Code.Description: Vote expressed as abstain. In this case, the issuing company will add the number of shares to the quorum of the meeting. If the voting right is not executed, it will not be added to the quorum. In this case, code NOAC should be used

Code.Name: AMGT
Code.Description: Vote against management.

Code.Name: BSPL
Code.Description: Receive equities from the Share Premium Reserve of the company and considered as a capital distribution rather than a disbursement of income with different tax implications (typically found in Australia)

Code.Name: BUYA
Code.Description: Buy additional securities to round up position

Code.Name: CASE
Code.Description: Corporate action option includes a distribution of both cash and securities to holders

Code.Name: CASH
Code.Description: Distribution of cash to holders

Code.Name: CERT
Code.Description: Certification is provided.

Code.Name: CEXC
Code.Description: Vote to consent to change the terms of the securities agreement and to exchange securities

Code.Name: CONN
Code.Description: Vote not to approve the event or proposal.

Code.Name: CONY
Code.Description: Vote to approve the event or proposal

Code.Name: CTEN
Code.Description: Vote to consent to change the terms of the securities agreement and to tender securities for cash

Code.Name: EXER
Code.Description: Exercise intermediate securities or warrants

Code.Name: LAPS
Code.Description: Allow event or entitled security to expire

Code.Name: MKDW
Code.Description: Mark Down the global certificate as a result of a corporate action (instruction from ICSDs to common depositories who are holding the global certificate on behalf of the ICSDs

Code.Name: MKUP
Code.Description: Mark up the global certificate as a result of a corporate action (instruction from ICSDs to common depositories who are holding the global certificate on behalf of the ICSDs)

Code.Name: MNGT
Code.Description: Vote with management

Code.Name: MPUT
Code.Description: An option that allows a holder to elect to retain their holding, eg, a putable bond.

Code.Name: NOAC
Code.Description: Option for the account owner not to take part in the event. This would include opt-out for class actions and lodging of dissenters' rights.

Code.Name: NOQU
Code.Description: The account owner is a Non-Qualified Investor.

Code.Name: OFFR
Code.Description: In a remarketing of variable notes, the margin that shareholders can propose in respect of the next interest period

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Generic corporate action option to be used in case that no other specific code is appropriate

Code.Name: OVER
Code.Description: Subscribe to more equities than underlying securities position allows

Code.Name: PROX
Code.Description: Issue a proxy card in case of voting.

Code.Name: PRUN
Code.Description: Proceeds not known during election period. The option can result in cash and/or securities.

Code.Name: QINV
Code.Description: The account owner is a Qualified Investor

Code.Name: SECU
Code.Description: Distribution of securities to holders

Code.Name: SLLE
Code.Description: Sell the intermediate securities

Code.Name: SPLI
Code.Description: Option to give a split instruction, eg, a split voting instruction on a meeting

Code.Name: TAXI
Code.Description: Tax instruction.

Validation.Comment: In option H, if Qualifier is CAOP, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22)

Code.Name: ABST
Code.Description: Vote expressed as abstain. In this case, the issuing company will add the number of shares to the quorum of the meeting. If the voting right is not executed, it will not be added to the quorum. In this case, code NOAC should be used.

Code.Name: AMGT
Code.Description: Vote against management.

Code.Name: BSPL
Code.Description: Receive equities from the Share Premium Reserve of the company and considered as a capital distribution rather than a disbursement of income with different tax implications (typically found in Australia).

Code.Name: BUYA
Code.Description: Buy additional securities to round up position.

Code.Name: CASE
Code.Description: Corporate action option includes a distribution of both cash and securities to holders.

Code.Name: CASH
Code.Description: Distribution of cash to holders.

Code.Name: CERT
Code.Description: Certification is provided.

Code.Name: CEXC
Code.Description: Vote to consent to change the terms of the securities agreement and to exchange securities.

Code.Name: CONN
Code.Description: Vote not to approve the event or proposal.

Code.Name: CONY
Code.Description: Vote to approve the event or proposal.

Code.Name: CTEN
Code.Description: Vote to consent to change the terms of the securities agreement and to tender securities for cash.

Code.Name: EXER
Code.Description: Exercise intermediate securities or warrants.

Code.Name: LAPS
Code.Description: Allow event or entitled security to expire.

Code.Name: MKDW
Code.Description: Mark down the global certificate as a result of a corporate action (instruction from ICSDs to common depositories who are holding the global certificate on behalf of the ICSDs.

Code.Name: MKUP
Code.Description: Mark up the global certificate as a result of a corporate action (instruction from ICSDs to common depositories who are holding the global certificate on behalf of the ICSDs).

Code.Name: MNGT
Code.Description: Vote with management.

Code.Name: MPUT
Code.Description: An option that allows a holder to elect to retain their holding, for example, a putable bond.

Code.Name: NOAC
Code.Description: Option for the account owner not to take part in the event. This would include opt-out for class actions and lodging of dissenters' rights.

Code.Name: NOQU
Code.Description: The account owner is a Non-Qualified Investor.

Code.Name: OFFR
Code.Description: In a remarketing of variable notes, the margin that shareholders can propose in respect of the next interest period.

Code.Name: OTHR
Code.Description: Generic corporate action option to be used in case that no other specific code is appropriate.

Code.Name: OVER
Code.Description: Subscribe to more equities than underlying securities position allows.

Code.Name: PROX
Code.Description: Issue a proxy card in case of voting.

Code.Name: PRUN
Code.Description: Proceeds not known during election period. The option can result in cash and/or securities.

Code.Name: QINV
Code.Description: The account owner is a Qualified Investor.

Code.Name: SECU
Code.Description: Distribution of securities to holders.

Code.Name: SLLE
Code.Description: Sell the intermediate securities.

Code.Name: SPLI
Code.Description: Option to give a split instruction, for example, a split voting instruction on a meeting.

Code.Name: TAXI
Code.Description: Tax instruction.

Validation.Comment: In option F, if Qualifier is CHAN and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: BERE
Code.Description: Change from bearer into registered form.

Code.Name: CERT
Code.Description: Change of all instruments into certificates.

Code.Name: DEPH
Code.Description: Change from dematerialised into physical form

Code.Name: GPPH
Code.Description: Change from global permanent to physical form.

Code.Name: GTGP
Code.Description: Change from global temporary to global permanent form.

Code.Name: GTPH
Code.Description: Change from global temporary to physical form.

Code.Name: NAME
Code.Description: Change of the issuing company's name

Code.Name: PHDE
Code.Description: Change from physical into dematerialised form.

Code.Name: REBE
Code.Description: Change from registered into bearer form.

Code.Name: TERM
Code.Description: Change in the terms of the security.

Validation.Comment: If Qualifier is COLE and Data Source Scheme is not present, Indicator must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K22):

Code.Name: COLA
Code.Description: The securities are eligible for collateral purposes.

Code.Name: COLN
Code.Description: The securities are not eligible for collateral purposes.

Validation.Comment: Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).

Option.Name: B
Option.Specification: (Identification Of Security)(Description Of Security) |(Description Of Security)

Validation.Comment: Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K36):

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, ie, the principal, of a debt instrument

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, eg, a number of shares

Validation.Comment: In option C, if Qualifier is QINS, Quantity Code must contain the following code (Error code(s): K36):

Code.Name: QALL
Code.Description: Instruction applies to the entire eligible balance of underlying securities

Validation.Comment: Date must be a valid date expressed as YYYYMMDD (Error code(s): T50).
Time must be a valid time expressed as HHMMSS (Error code(s): T38).
In option R, if Qualifier is TAXB or Qualifier is WITF or Qualifier is WITL and Data Source Scheme is not present, Rate Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K92):

Code.Name: BWIT
Code.Description: Withholding tax related to payments subject to Back up Withholding.

Code.Name: FTCA
Code.Description: Withholding Tax related to income subject to FATCA (Foreign Account Tax Compliance Act).

Code.Name: NRAT
Code.Description: Withholding tax related to income subject NRA (Non Resident Alien).

Validation.Comment: When Sign is present, Rate must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).

Qualifier.Name: OFFR
Qualifier.Description: Generic Cash Price Received per Product
Qualifier.Options: A, B, E, F, J, L

Qualifier.Name: PRPP
Qualifier.Description: Generic Cash Price Paid per Product

Validation.Comment: In option A, Percentage Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points below par, for example, a discount price of 2.0% equals a price of 98 when par is 100.

Code.Name: PRCT
Code.Description: Price expressed as a percentage of par.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as the number of percentage points above par, for example, a premium price of 2.0% equals a price of 102 when par is 100.

Code.Name: YIEL
Code.Description: Price expressed as a yield.

Validation.Comment: In option B or F or J, Amount Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: ACTU
Code.Description: Price expressed as an amount of currency per unit or per share.

Code.Name: DISC
Code.Description: Price expressed as a discount amount.

Code.Name: PLOT
Code.Description: Price expressed as an amount of money per lot.

Code.Name: PREM
Code.Description: Price expressed as a premium.

Validation.Comment: In option E, if Qualifier is OFFR, Price Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: TBSP
Code.Description: Price to be specified by account owner.

Code.Name: UNSP
Code.Description: Price is unspecified.

Code.Name: UKWN
Code.Description: Price is unknown by the sender or has not been established.

Validation.Comment: In option F, if Qualifier is OFFR, Quantity Type Code must contain one of the following codes (Error code(s): K90):

Code.Name: AMOR
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the current amortised face amount of a bond, for example, a periodic reduction/increase of a bond's principal amount.

Code.Name: FAMT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as an amount representing the face amount, that is, the principal, of a debt instrument.

Code.Name: UNIT
Code.Description: Quantity expressed as a number, for example, a number of shares.

Validation.Comment: When Sign is present, Price must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).
When Sign is present, Index Points must not be zero (Error code(s): T14).
Currency Code must be a valid ISO 4217 currency code (Error code(s): T52).
Identifier Code must be a registered BIC or BEI (Error code(s): T27,T28,T29,T45)

Proprietary code (Format Option R) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26).

Name & Address (Format Option Q) must not start or end with a slash '/' and not contain two consecutive slashes '//'. For field formats with more than 1 line, the rule applies for each line (Error code(s): T26).

fieldvalidation.name: U09
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "User has used tag 119 in a message that is not a candidate for special processing"

fieldvalidation.name: U03
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "When populating an end-to-end reference, both fields 111 and 121 must be populated: a message that contains only one of these two fields will not be accepted by FIN."

fieldvalidation.name: FB-35B-A
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: B.F35B.Identification_Of_Security + " is not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c"

fieldvalidation.name: FB-35B-B
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";

fieldvalidation.name: FD-35B-A
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: D.F35B.Identification_Of_Security + " is not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c"

fieldvalidation.name: FD-35B-B
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Not a valid Security Identification. Required format is ISIN1!e12!c";

fieldvalidation.name: FD-13A-A
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "Number Id must be a number ranging from 001 to 999 or (Unsolicited) value UNS."

fieldvalidation.name: C1
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "If the message is a cancellation, ie, Function of the Message (field 23G) is CANC, then subsequence A1 (Linkages) must be present at least once in the message, and in one and only one occurrence of A1, field :20C::PREV must be present; consequently, in all other occurrences of A1, field :20C::PREV is not allowed."

fieldvalidation.name: C2
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In sequence D, if field :22F::CAOP//SPLI is present, then field 70E::INST is mandatory in the same sequence. Network validation C2 failed."

fieldvalidation.name: C3
fieldvalidation.comment: C3: In subsequence B2, field :93B::ELIG cannot appear more than twice (maximum two occurrences). When repeated, one occurrence must have Quantity Type Code FAMT and the other occurrence must have Quantity Type Code AMOR (Error code(s): C71).
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In subsequence B2, field :93B::ELIG cannot appear more than twice (maximum two occurrences). When repeated, one occurrence must have Quantity Type Code FAMT and the other occurrence must have Quantity Type Code AMOR."

fieldvalidation.name: C4
fieldvalidation.comment: C4: In sequence D, field :36B::QINS or QREC cannot appear more than twice (maximum two occurrences). When repeated, one occurrence must have Quantity Type Code FAMT and the other occurrence must have Quantity Type Code AMOR (Error code(s): C72). Note: When used with format option C, field 36a qualifiers QINS or QREC cannot be repeated.
fieldvalidation.formula: If(SecCount(D.F36a, "QINS") > 1, SecCount(D.F36a, "QINS") == 2 && FieldValueExistsInAll(D.F36a, "QINS.FormatOption", "B") && FieldValueExistsInAtLeastOne(D.F36a, "QINS.Quantity_Type_Code", "FAMT") && FieldValueExistsInAtLeastOne(D.F36a, "QINS.Quantity_Type_Code", "AMOR"), true)
fieldvalidation.actionmessage: "In sequence D, field :36B::QINS cannot appear more than twice (maximum two occurrences). When repeated, one occurrence must have Quantity Type Code FAMT and the other occurrence must have Quantity Type Code AMOR. When used with format option C, field 36a qualifiers QINS cannot be repeated."
